result.execSummary:
The defendant Monique S. Rios was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Order to Extend Probation s/BNB/1-8-19
Agent requested Warrant quashed with Extension

10:37 AM Defendant Monique S. Rios not in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states this matter was requested by the Clerk as financial obligations have not been paid in full.  Requests warrant be issued on defendant's failure to appear along with extension of probation until warrant is satisfied.
BY THE COURT:  Warrant will issue and the underlying probation be extended until Ms. Rios satisfies the warrant.
Probation review hearing on January 4, 2019 at 10:30 am.

and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Hearing (Hearing already held 2-8-18)
Extending Probation for Unpaid Court Obligations/Restitution s/BNB/2-12-18

Defendant Monique S. Rios in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that restitution is still owing so today's hearing was set.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant signed a sheet last week that probation would be extended for 1 year.

BY THE COURT:  Court finds that good faith effort was not made; court will extend the Probation for 1 year until February 17, 2019.
Probation review hearing on February 12, 2018 at 11:00 am.
Probation review hearing on February 2, 2018 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: MARQUETTE COUNTY DNA PROOF OF SUBMISSION
restitution supplement

Defendant Monique S. Rios in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that he did meet with the defendant and an offer was provided.    Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Counts 1 & 2.  Atty Hendee has no objection to early termination of probation with conditions.  Defendant agrees.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.    Defendant waives their right to an attorney.    Court finds waiver made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant enters a Guilty plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Counts 1 & 2.

Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.  Atty Hendee states that there is no agreement to expunge; it is only for early termination.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Counts 1 & 2:  Withhold Sentence; 24 months Probation with conditions:
Court Costs = $243.00 on each count
DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the Agent
Restitution = $2,100.00 + $210.00 surcharge = $2,310.00

  If after 12 months the defendant has paid the fine and costs and Restitution in full and has had no criminal violations, the defendant may petition the court for early termination of Probation.

Pre-trial conference at 01-26-2016 09:15 am.
Return date at 02-17-2016 02:30 pm.

Defendant Monique S. Rios in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.  Court finds probable cause to support the charges.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

Court questions the defendant.    Defendant waives their right to an attorney in order to have a conference with the District Attorney.    Court finds waiver made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.
BY THE COURT:   Set for Return and pre-trial.  Return date scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 02:30 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 09:15 am.
STATEMENT OF COMPLIANCE
